com.uk.tsl.rfid.asciiprotocol.responders

Class AsciiCommandResponderBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uk.tsl.rfid.asciiprotocol.responders.AsciiResponseBase
      • com.uk.tsl.rfid.asciiprotocol.responders.AsciiCommandResponderBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAsciiCommandResponder, IAsciiResponse
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsciiCommandLibraryResponderBase, SwitchResponder

    public abstract class AsciiCommandResponderBase
extends AsciiResponseBase
implements IAsciiCommandResponder
    Base implementation of IAsciiCommandResponder

      • processReceivedLine

        public final boolean processReceivedLine(java.lang.String fullLine,
                                         boolean moreLinesAvailable)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Each correctly terminated line from the device is passed to this method for processing
        Specified by:
        processReceivedLine in interface IAsciiCommandResponder
        Parameters:
        fullLine - The line to be processed
        moreLinesAvailable - When true indicates there are additional lines to be processed (and will also be passed to this method)
        Returns:
        True if this line should not be passed to any other responder
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • buildCommandLine

        protected void buildCommandLine(java.lang.StringBuilder line)
        Builds the command line to send to the reader to execute the command
        Parameters:
        line - The command line to append to When overriding this method call the base class to construct the command line as known to the base class and then append the additional parameters to the end of the line

      • processReceivedLine

        protected boolean processReceivedLine(java.lang.String fullLine,
                                      java.lang.String header,
                                      java.lang.String value,
                                      boolean moreAvailable)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Each correctly terminated line from the device is passed to this method for processing
        Parameters:
        fullLine - The line to be processed
        header - The response line header excluding the colon e.g. 'CS' for a command started response
        value - The response line following the colon e.g. '.iv'
        moreAvailable - When true indicates there are additional lines to be processed (and will also be passed to this method)
        Returns:
        Derived classes should return true if this line should NOT be passed to any other responder. This base class provides default handling for the following responses: CS Sets ResponseStarted to true PR Populates Parameters with parameters occurring within command responses ME Populates Messages with messages occurring within command responses
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • responseDidFinish

        protected void responseDidFinish(boolean async)
        The is called when the responder received a line with an OK: or an ER: header. i.e. the command is complete
        Parameters:
        async - True if the command finished asynchronously Warning: To ensure correct operation of synchronous commands the super class method must be invoked

      • responseDidReceiveParameter

        protected boolean responseDidReceiveParameter(java.lang.String parameter)
        This method is called for each parameter in the parameters (PR:) list. Returns true if the parameter was handled or false otherwise. Derived classes can override this method to extract individual parameters from the PR: line
        Parameters:
        parameter - A single parameter extracted from the PR: response, excluding the '-' and trimmed of leading and trailing whitespace
        Returns:
        Return true if the parameter was handled

      • responseDidStart

        protected void responseDidStart()
        This is called when the responder receives the CS: line
